articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: At least 27 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded by Israeli fire near a food distribution site in the southern Gaza Strip, local health authorities said, in the latest bout of chaos and bloodshed to plague the aid operation.
articles.title: At least 27 Palestinians killed near Gaza aid site, medics say

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: South Korea woke on Wednesday to a new liberal president, Lee Jae-myung, who vowed to raise the country from the turmoil of a martial law crisis and revive an economy reeling from slowing growth and the threat of global protectionism.
articles.title: South Korea's liberal new president Lee Jae-myung vows economic revival, judgement against martial law

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Joseph Ax
articles.description: The family of the Egyptian national charged with tossing gasoline bombs at a pro-Israeli rally in Colorado was taken into federal custody on Tuesday, officials said.
articles.title: Family of Colorado fire-bomb suspect taken into ICE custody

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain pledged on Wednesday to supply 100,000 drones to Ukraine by the end of the current financial year in April 2026, marking a tenfold increase, after saying the unmanned aerial vehicles had transformed the way wars are fought.
articles.title: Britain pledges to deliver 100,000 drones to Ukraine by April 2026

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: South Korea's new President Lee Jae-myung rode a wave of voter anger against the December martial law attempt by his ousted predecessor, but his ability to lead will be judged by the strength of his policies.
articles.title: Riding wave of voter anger, South Korea's Lee now faces policy challenges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Tuesday that two projectiles crossed from Syria towards Israel and fell in open areas.
articles.title: Israeli military says two projectiles crossed from Syria towards Israel

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish
articles.description: U.N. inspectors monitoring Iran's Fordow nuclear site confronted a major gap in their knowledge last year as they watched trucks carrying advanced uranium-enriching centrifuges roll into the facility dug into a mountain south of Tehran.
articles.title: Any Trump deal with Iran must tackle nuclear watchdog's blind spots

articles.author: Jihoon Lee, Cynthia Kim
articles.description: The new South Korean administration will likely make efforts to buy time for U.S. trade talks, as it studies the negotiations of bigger neighbours Japan and China for leverage, according to sources familiar with the ruling party's thinking.
articles.title: South Korea's new leader to seek more time for US trade talks

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Senior Ukrainian officials visited Washington seeking U.S. support against Russia, as Kyiv showed its ability to fight on by setting off an explosive device under a bridge that has become a symbol of the Kremlin's claims on Ukrainian territory.
articles.title: Zelenskiy aides visit US as Ukraine strikes Russian-held territory

articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: U.S. federal prosecutors have accused two Chinese nationals of smuggling a dangerous biological pathogen that had the potential to be used as an agricultural terrorism weapon into the United States for research.
articles.title: Justice Department accuses two Chinese researchers of smuggling 'potential agroterrorism weapon' into US
